text: The Eretz Israel League, was an association football league. It was played between 1928 and 1948, during the British Mandate of Palestine (now Israel). It was organised by the Eretz Israel Football Association. ==Seasons== ;Key † Champions also won the People's Cup during the same season (number of titles) A running tally of the total number of championships won by each club is kept in brackets. :Full league standings and top scorer details not known at this time. Season Winner (number of titles) Notes 1928 Maccabi Hasmonean Jerusalem (1) The Israeli Football Association – 1931–32 British Police (1)† – 1932–33 – 1933–34 Hapoel Tel Aviv (1)† – 1934–35 Hapoel Tel Aviv (2) 1935–36 Maccabi Tel Aviv (1) – 1936–37 Maccabi Tel Aviv (2) – 1937–38 Hapoel Tel Aviv (3)† 1938–39 1939–40 Hapoel Tel Aviv (4) – 1940–41 – 1941–42 Maccabi Tel Aviv (3) – 1942–43 1943–44 Hapoel Tel Aviv (5) – 1944–45 1945–46 – 1946–47 Maccabi Tel Aviv (4)† – 1947–48 A Break in League Play Aspaklaria Shel HaSport (The Sport Mirror), 11 January 1948, p. 1, col. 6 – 1948–49 – Winner Titles Years won Hapoel Tel Aviv 5 1934, 1935, 1938, 1940, 1944 Maccabi Tel Aviv 4 1936, 1937, 1942, 1947 Maccabi Hasmonean Jerusalem 1 1928 British Police 1 1931 Nordia(Beitar) Tel Aviv 1 1948 ==Notes== ==References== Category:Football in Israel Category:1928 establishments in Europe Category:1948 disestablishments
title: Palestine League
